1.description: First, create the blade, which will serve as the primary functional element of the knife, providing the cutting edge and defining the knife's overall shape. This blade will be positioned at the front of the object, forming the crucial starting point for the subsequent assembly of components that will enhance its usability and effectiveness.

2.description: Next, add the guard just above the blade, where it transitions into the handle, to serve as a protective barrier for the user's hand and to enhance the structural stability of the knife. This component not only prevents accidental slips onto the blade during use but also reinforces the connection between the blade and the handle, ensuring a secure and safe grip.

3.description: Then, attach the handle to the lower portion of the guard, ensuring it fits snugly against the guard and blade to create a seamless transition. This handle serves as the primary grip for the user, providing comfort and control while also balancing the weight of the blade and guard above it, thus enhancing the overall functionality of the object.

4.description: Finally, add the butt at the end of the handle to provide a finished appearance and enhance the overall balance of the knife. This component not only helps secure the handle in the user's grip but also prevents slippage during use, ensuring greater control and safety while working with the blade.
